intro: Cleisostomopsis roseus, commonly known as the red-flowered stiltroot, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its striking red flowers and slender, often climbing stems. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and have a distinctive tubular structure. Cleisostomopsis roseus is native to parts of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
